org.macquarie.philosophy
Class Philosopher

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      org.macquarie.philosophy.Philosopher
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Philosopher
extends java.lang.Thread

Simulate a single philosopher in the dining philosophers example. Each philosopher is an autonomous individual so this class extends the Thread class so that we can execute each Philosopher in a thread of its own.

Author:
Dominic Verity

Field Detail

mGenerator

private static java.util.Random mGenerator
Random number generator for generating random pauses.

mNumPhilosophers

private static int mNumPhilosophers
Counter to record the number of philosopher objects constructed to date.

mLeftChopsticksHeld

private static int mLeftChopsticksHeld
Counter to record the number of chopsticks currently held in the left hands of philosophers. The party will be in deadlock when every philosopher is holding a chopstick in his left hand (mNumPhilosophers == mLeftChopsticksHeld).

mLeft

private Chopstick mLeft
Reference to the Chopstick object to the left of this philosopher.

mRight

private Chopstick mRight
Reference to the Chopstick object to the right of this philosopher.

private int mNum
The unique identification number of this philosopher.

randomPause

public static void randomPause(long pMaxPause)
Sleep for a randomly determined number of milliseconds.

Parameters:
pMaxPause - the maximum number of milliseconds to sleep for.

run

public void run()

Implements the behaviour of a philosopher, that is:

  • Pause.
  • Try to pick up chopstick in left hand.
  • Once successful pause.
  • Try to pick up second chopstick in right hand.
  • Once successful eat and drop both chopsticks.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread
See Also:
Thread.run()
